def_en: You use must to indicate that you think it is very important or necessary for something to happen. You use must not or mustn't to indicate that you think it is very important or necessary for something not to happen.

def_cn: (通常因为规定或法律)必须，应当
def_en: You use must to indicate that it is necessary for something to happen, usually because of a rule or law.

def_cn: (用于表示肯定推测)一定，谅必
def_en: You use must to indicate that you are fairly sure that something is the case.

def_cn: (用于表示据已知情况推测)很可能是，想必是，肯定是
def_en: You use must, or must have with a past participle, to indicate that you believe that something is the case, because of the available evidence.

def_cn: (用于表示前者为后者的前提)应该已经(发生)
def_en: If you say that one thing must have happened in order for something else to happen, you mean that it is necessary for the first thing to have happened before the second thing can happen.

def_cn: (用于表示意图)一定要，坚持要
def_en: You use must to express your intention to do something.

def_cn: (用于表示建议或邀请)务必，一定要
def_en: You use must to make suggestions or invitations very forcefully.

def_cn: (用于表示同情)必定，想必
def_en: You use must in remarks and comments where you are expressing sympathy.

def_cn: (用于强调)我得说/我得承认
def_en: You use must in conversation in expressions such as 'I must say' and 'I must admit' in order to emphasize a point that you are making.

def_cn: (用于引起读者或听众的注意)一定要注意/一定记住
def_en: You use must in expressions such as 'it must be noted' and 'it must be remembered' in order to draw the reader's or listener's attention to what you are about to say.

def_cn: (用于问句中表示生气)偏偏，非要
def_en: You use must in questions to express your anger or irritation about something that someone has done, usually because you do not understand their behaviour.

def_cn: (用于感叹句，表示惊讶或震惊)一定是，准是
def_en: You use must in exclamations to express surprise or shock.

def_cn: 必不可少的事物;一定要做的事
def_en: If you refer to something as a must, you mean that it is absolutely necessary.

def_cn: 如果你一定要(这样做的话)
def_en: You say 'if you must' when you know that you cannot stop someone doing something that you think is wrong or stupid.

def_cn: 如果你一定想要知道的话
def_en: You say 'if you must know' when you tell someone something that you did not want them to know and you want to suggest that you think they were wrong to ask you about it.
